content: in this legal case the tartu county court made a final decision after 10 months of proceedings the case involved two parties kj and mj who were disputing the division of joint assets specifically a property located in xxx the court ruled in favor of kj terminating the joint ownership and granting sole ownership to them mj is required to give consent for the termination and update the land register accordingly kj is also obligated to compensate mj for obtaining sole ownership the court determined that mj is responsible for compensating kj for their share of the loan related to the property the court considered evidence and calculations to determine the compensation amounts a real estate agency conducted a valuation of the property to determine its market value the court addressed the disputed value and calculated the deviation from the principle of equality in favor of the plaintiff the court also discussed loan payments made by both parties and considered them as contributions towards the property the court ordered the plaintiff to pay the defendant a specific amount the court decision was made by the civil chamber of the supreme court the court also ruled in favor of the plaintiffs alternative claim and replaced the defendants declaration of intent with a court decision the court determined that the procedural costs of the case will be borne by both parties
